step1.sentence: Our new coordinator is really on the ball — she caught three errors before the documents even left the office.

step2.story: The hotel staff were clearly on the ball that evening — every small request was handled within minutes, and guests' names were remembered from the check-in.

step3.story: When the supplier called to say a key component would arrive three days late, most of the production schedule would have collapsed under the delay. But the operations manager was on the ball — she had already identified a backup supplier the week before, just in case. Within two hours, replacement parts were confirmed and the line kept moving without interruption. The director mentioned it at the all-hands meeting the following Monday, and the manager shrugged it off. She simply never assumed things would go to plan.

meaning.realUsageKo: 상황을 잘 파악하고 신속하고 유능하게 대응하는 사람을 표현할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 스포츠에서 공을 항상 주시하며 즉각적으로 반응하는 선수의 이미지에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 칭찬의 표현으로, 예상치 못한 상황에서 특히 빛을 발하는 사람에게 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She is really on the ball — never misses a detail.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 정말 유능해요 — 세부 사항 하나도 놓치지 않아요.
